Detailed Description

A DualFilterProvider is used to access rows of a child provider which match a criterion specified in a filter rule.

Member Enumeration Documentation

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DualFilterProvider::DualFilterProvider (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

DualFilterProvider::DualFilterProvider (  Provider *  provider,
FilterRule *  fst_rule,
FilterRule *  snd_rule,
INT  fst_columnid = 0,
INT  snd_columnid = 0,
FilterOperator  op = AndFilterOp,
BOOLEAN  negation = FALSE
) 
 

On construction the following parameters have to be specified: provider: The provider which should be filtered. rule: Specify how the rows are filtered. columnid: Specify on which columnid rule has to be applied. negation: Specify whether rule must be negated.

INT  row,
BOOLEAN  negate
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Determines whether or not the specified row should be included.

Parameters:
base_provider Child provider.
row Index of row to test.
negate TRUE to negate the result, FALSE otherwise.
Returns:
TRUE to include row row, FALSE otherwise.
